helpdesk_ticket.description:
Hi Team,

I have ordered Vivamom SF from Pharma easy app, not sure whether it’s my
mistake or App , I have got delivered with Two packs of Vivamom.

But I have a doctor prescription attached which is saying Vivamom SF. Now
we are not going to consume it .  I am requesting for Exchange of Vivamom
with Vivamom SF. I have got it delivered today itself which are not used.

Requesting some one to Adress this, When i called customer care they are
saying it’s not returnable which i dont understand . We can return or
exchange from other pharmacy if we buy from others.

Please consider this a special request and do the need full and next time
when i order i will make sure we are selecting the correct product.

--

I am sorry to inform you that the requested medicine comes under non-returnable medicine/item. Hence, we will be unable to return the requested medicine or process a refund. Please accept my sincere apology for the inconvenience caused to you.   As per PharmEasy's return policy, an item marked as "non-returnable" on the product detail page or medicines whose return window has expired cannot be returned. Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Healthy.     Regards,  Manisha

notes.body:
Merged from ticket 22249272  
      Subject: Concern Regarding Lack of Transparency and Issue with Medicine Replacement  
      Description:  
 Dear PharmEasy Team, 
   
 I am writing to express my concern regarding the lack of transparency in my recent medicine order. The supplier’s contact details appear to be intentionally hidden on the invoice ( copy attached) , and despite my efforts to search online, I am unable to find any address or contact information for the supplier. 
   
 Additionally, I requested to replace one medicine strip, but your representative informed me that this is not possible. This has caused inconvenience, as customers should have access to supplier details and basic flexibility for issues like replacements. 
   
 I request you to kindly look into this matter and provide a resolution at the earliest. Please share the correct supplier contact details and advise how the replacement can be processed. 
   
 Thank you for your support. 
   
           
 Regards, 
 
Anil Bhandvalkar   
 
 9768626086

notes.body_html:
Merged from ticket 22249272

Subject: Concern Regarding Lack of Transparency and Issue with Medicine Replacement

Description:
Dear PharmEasy Team,

I am writing to express my concern regarding the lack of transparency in my recent medicine order. The supplier’s contact details appear to be intentionally hidden on the invoice ( copy attached) , and despite my efforts to search online, I am unable to find any address or contact information for the supplier.

Additionally, I requested to replace one medicine strip, but your representative informed me that this is not possible. This has caused inconvenience, as customers should have access to supplier details and basic flexibility for issues like replacements.

I request you to kindly look into this matter and provide a resolution at the earliest. Please share the correct supplier contact details and advise how the replacement can be processed.

Thank you for your support.

Regards,
Anil Bhandvalkar

notes.body: Hello Anil,     Greetings from PharmEasy!      With regards to your order #655230493685362688-71682, I understand your query. Please note, we share the invoice in standard format, including the details of the Pharmacist for all orders. I am sorry to inform you that we are unable to comply with your request.     Also, please be informed that we are currently unable to offer a replacement for the medicine or product, as this facility is not available. However, we can process a return after the verification process. To assist you further, kindly provide the name and quantity of the medicines, along with the reason for the return.    Awaiting your response.     Regards,  Habiba

notes.body:
Merged from ticket 22253132  
      Subject: URGENT: Gross Negligence & Delivery Refusal for Child's Medication - Orders #655498504036679680 & #655449478663073792  
      Description:  
 
 To the Senior Management / Grievance Officer at Pharmeasy, 
 I am writing this email in a state of extreme distress and anger regarding the appalling lack of empathy and professional ethics displayed by your team regarding two orders placed for my 4-year-old daughter. 
 
Order Numbers: 655498504036679680 & 655449478663073792 
 This has been a harrowing experience of lies, delays, and unprofessionalism. 
 I placed these orders yesterday, Dec 4th. For one order, I specifically paid extra for Express Delivery, with a promised time of 6:00 PM. The other was promised by 10:00 PM. Instead of delivering the medicine, your system updated the status to "Delivery delayed based on customer request."
 
 This is a blatant lie. I never requested a delay. Why would I pay for Express delivery for my sick child and then ask you to delay it? This is gaslighting at its finest. I called your support team at 5:18 PM yesterday to correct this. The agent assured me she was raising a complaint and that I would receive the order that night. That was another broken promise. 
 Today, the status showed "Out for Delivery" between 9:30 AM – 2:30 PM. Desperate to get the medicine, I called the delivery executive directly. 
 
  I explained this is for a 4-year-old and requested early delivery.  
  He refused. He bluntly stated he would not deliver before 1:00 PM.  
  Helpless, I agreed and asked him to come as soon as possible after 1:00 PM.  
 
 The 2:30 PM deadline passed with no delivery. I called your support line again—no resolution, only assurances and promises. I called the delivery executive repeatedly, and he ignored my calls. 
 Finally, at 3:16 PM today, he answered. He claimed he had "bike issues" and was "nearby." When I simply asked him for a specific time so I could stop waiting in anxiety, he disconnected the call on me.
 
 You are not delivering a pair of shoes or a gadget; you are handling healthcare. My 4-year-old child needs this medication. I paid for speed, I paid for convenience, and instead, I have spent the last 24 hours chasing your support team and being hung up on by your drivers. 
 You have taken my money, lied about my delivery preferences to cover your operational failures, and left a parent helpless while their child waits for medicine. 
 I demand the following immediately: 
 
  Immediate delivery of these orders within the next hour.  
  A full explanation as to why the status was falsely marked as "customer requested delay.  
 
 Please do not send me a templated apology. I need this escalated immediately.  
 
 
         
Regards Tathagata Kandar Marketeer Mobile: +91 97313 55686 
         
 

 
 Disclaimer: 
 This email contains proprietary, business-confidential, and/or privileged material. The information contained in this e-mail is intended solely for the use of the individual to whom it is addressed. If you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any disclosure, copying, distribution or action in relation to the contents of this email is strictly prohibited and may be unlawful and request you to permanently delete this message and any attachments herein. You are requested to advise the sender, of your receipt of this email by return e-mail. The Company and its affiliates rule out any and every liability resulting from this or any other electronic transmission.
notes.body_html:
Merged from ticket 22253132

Subject: URGENT: Gross Negligence & Delivery Refusal for Child's Medication - Orders #655498504036679680 & #655449478663073792

Description:
To the Senior Management / Grievance Officer at Pharmeasy,
I am writing this email in a state of extreme distress and anger regarding the appalling lack of empathy and professional ethics displayed by your team regarding two orders placed for my 4-year-old daughter.
Order Numbers: 655498504036679680 & 655449478663073792
This has been a harrowing experience of lies, delays, and unprofessionalism.
I placed these orders yesterday, Dec 4th. For one order, I specifically paid extra for Express Delivery, with a promised time of 6:00 PM. The other was promised by 10:00 PM. Instead of delivering the medicine, your system updated the status to "Delivery delayed based on customer request."
This is a blatant lie. I never requested a delay. Why would I pay for Express delivery for my sick child and then ask you to delay it? This is gaslighting at its finest. I called your support team at 5:18 PM yesterday to correct this. The agent assured me she was raising a complaint and that I would receive the order that night. That was another broken promise.
Today, the status showed "Out for Delivery" between 9:30 AM – 2:30 PM. Desperate to get the medicine, I called the delivery executive directly.
  • I explained this is for a 4-year-old and requested early delivery.
  • He refused. He bluntly stated he would not deliver before 1:00 PM.
  • Helpless, I agreed and asked him to come as soon as possible after 1:00 PM.
The 2:30 PM deadline passed with no delivery. I called your support line again—no resolution, only assurances and promises. I called the delivery executive repeatedly, and he ignored my calls.
Finally, at 3:16 PM today, he answered. He claimed he had "bike issues" and was "nearby." When I simply asked him for a specific time so I could stop waiting in anxiety, he disconnected the call on me.
You are not delivering a pair of shoes or a gadget; you are handling healthcare. My 4-year-old child needs this medication. I paid for speed, I paid for convenience, and instead, I have spent the last 24 hours chasing your support team and being hung up on by your drivers.
You have taken my money, lied about my delivery preferences to cover your operational failures, and left a parent helpless while their child waits for medicine.
I demand the following immediately:
  1. Immediate delivery of these orders within the next hour.
  2. A full explanation as to why the status was falsely marked as "customer requested delay.
Please do not send me a templated apology. I need this escalated immediately.

Regards
Tathagata Kandar
Marketeer
Mobile: +91 97313 55686

notes.body: Hello Tathagata,     Greetings from PharmEasy!     This email is with reference to the concern raised for order #655449478663073792-96451.     We have received an update from our logistics team. As per the update, your order has been delivered on 05 December 2025, 3:39PM. Please accept my sincere apology for the inconvenience caused to you. We have shared the required feedback with the delivery agent and we will make sure that such instances are not repeated in the future.     Please consider this as a one-off instance as we aim to provide the best of services to our customers and such instances are very rare.     Since you are a valued customer, as a token of apology, we have credited Rs.30/- to your PharmEasy wallet on 04 December 2025.     We are marking the ticket as resolved. PharmEasy looks forward to bettering your experience in the future.     For any further assistance, please reopen this ticket or reach out to us through our support channels, in the App or website, listed in the 'Need Help' section.      Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Have a great day ahead!     Regards,   PharmEasy

Greetings from PharmEasy!
 
This email is with reference to the concern raised for order #655449478663073792-96451.
 
We have received an update from our logistics team. As per the update, your order has been delivered on 05 December 2025, 3:39PM. Please accept my sincere apology for the inconvenience caused to you. We have shared the required feedback with the delivery agent and we will make sure that such instances are not repeated in the future.
 
Please consider this as a one-off instance as we aim to provide the best of services to our customers and such instances are very rare.

Since you are a valued customer, as a token of apology, we have credited Rs.30/- to your PharmEasy wallet on 04 December 2025.

We are marking the ticket as resolved. PharmEasy looks forward to bettering your experience in the future.

For any further assistance, please reopen this ticket or reach out to us through our support channels, in the App or website, listed in the 'Need Help' section.

Dear team,

My father (diabetic) in Chennai booked fasting & post‑breakfast blood tests
with Pharmacy last Sunday. The technician took only the fasting sample and
never returned for the post‑breakfast test.
Your team promised to come today
to collect the pending samples, but there is no call, no visit, no response
till now. This negligence is affecting my father’s treatment. Please
resolve urgently and arrange sample collection today with written
confirmation. Order ID: 6206689
*REGARDS,*
*K.PRADEEP*

 Dear team,

My father (diabetic) in Chennai booked fasting & post‑breakfast blood tests with Pharmacy last Sunday. The technician took only the fasting sample and never returned for the post‑breakfast test.
Your team promised to come today 
to collect the pending samples, but there is no call, no visit, no response till now. This negligence is affecting my father’s treatment. Please resolve urgently and arrange sample collection today with written confirmation. Order ID: 6206689
REGARDS,
K.PRADEEP

From: Pradeep karunakaran <kjk.pradeep@gmail.com>
Date: Thu, Dec 4, 2025 at 5:35 PM
Subject: very bad experience
To: grievance-officer@pharmeasy.in <grievance-officer@pharmeasy.in>


 Dear team,

My father (diabetic) in Chennai booked fasting & post‑breakfast blood tests with Pharmacy last Sunday. The technician took only the fasting sample and never returned for the post‑breakfast test.
Your team promised to come today 
to collect the pending samples, but there is no call, no visit, no response till now. This negligence is affecting my father’s treatment. Please resolve urgently and arrange sample collection today with written confirmation. Order ID: 6206689
REGARDS,
K.PRADEEP

helpdesk_ticket.description:
There is a complaint regarding the product which I received recently from PharmEasy “ acne UV advanced light protection, sunscreen” it is clearly visible that both the products is not similar as I am using this product from past six months and I have used a lot of tubes for this product and the product which I ordered. The quality is totally different as you can see in the picture the product I already have with myself is smooth enough in the silicon texture, but the the product which I received from pharmacy is not similar to the product I use. Please figure out the problem with this and get the refund for the same product.  The first picture contains the both the product, the product which I already use and the product which I received.  As you can see in the second picture, the texture of the cream which I received from the PharmEasy app  Andy third picture, you can see the texture of the cream. It is very silicon smooth enough. They both are very different. In fact in the colour in the texture and the product I received is quite sticky to my skin.
--

I assure you that this change in your order has occurred only if the Partner Retailer has exhausted all possible alternatives to source the unavailable medicine. I am sorry for the unpleasant experience that you had with our platform. It was never our intention to upset you by any means.

Also, I request you to place a new order after 7 days for the required medicine. As our retailer restocks the medicines every 7 days. If the medicine is still unavailable, I would request that you reach out to us. We will highlight your concern to the partner retailer.

Please be assured that your feedback has been duly noted and will be shared with the relevant team for future improvements.
​
Thank you for confirming that you have received the refund successfully.

For any further assistance, please reopen this ticket or reach out to us through our support channels, in the App or website, listed in the 'Need Help' section. 

Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Healthy.

Regards,
Sandhya Nackwal

helpdesk_ticket.description:
There is a complaint regarding the product which I received recently from
PharmEasy “ acne UV advanced light protection, sunscreen” it is clearly
visible that both the products is not similar as I am using this product
from past six months and I have used a lot of tubes for this product and
the product which I ordered. The quality is totally different as you can
see in the picture the product I already have with myself is smooth enough
in the silicon texture, but the the product which I received from pharmacy
is not similar to the product I use. Please figure out the problem with
this and get the refund for the same product.  The first picture contains
the both the product, the product which I already use and the product which
I received.  As you can see in the second picture, the texture of the cream
which I received from the PharmEasy app  Andy third picture, you can see
the texture of the cream. It is very silicon smooth enough. They both are
very different. In fact in the colour in the texture and the product I
received is quite sticky to my skin.

notes.body: Hello,      Greetings from PharmEasy!      I understand your concern regarding the mail.  I would like to inform you that we only export in pan-India. We regret the disappointment caused to you. Please note that in the future, if we expand our serviceability, you will be notified accordingly.  You may place a new order from the PharmEasy application or website, www.pharmeasy.in, or you may call us at  999 29 999 29 and press 1 to place an order. If the medicine is available, it will be delivered to you. Please note that the orders can only be placed from an Indian registered mobile number.      For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels in the App or website listed in the 'Need Help' section.   Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Healthy.     Regards,  Sandhya Nackwal

Hello Koshini, 

Greetings from PharmEasy!

This email is with regards to your order # 653442013024747520-49337, we apologize for the inconvenience caused to you with your order.

As per update received fomr our team, pleas ebeinforme dthat marklding can not be chagned to delivered. However we have arranged manull pick up for 1 qty of ANTIFLU 75MG STRIP OF 10 CAPSULES and same will be oickuo shortly.

Also the request for refund of Rs.693.16 /- in the PharmEasy wallet (refund cash) has been sent and the same will be reflected in your PharmEasy wallet within 24-48 hours.  We appreciate your patience in the meantime.

Once the amount gets credited to your PharmEasy wallet (refund cash) you can use the full amount in your next order and also there is no expiry for this amount.

If you have any queries, please feel free to get back to us.

For any further assistance, please reopen this ticket or reach out to us through our support channels, in the App or website, listed in the 'Need Help' section.
​
Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Have a great day ahead!
 
Regards,
PharmEasy
